content.question: A hose is connected to a nozzle, as shown in the figure. Both the hose and the nozzle have circular cross-sections. Water flows in the hose with a speed of <math alttext="0.3 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>. The radius <math alttext="r sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> of the hose is <math alttext="0.02 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.02</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> and the radius <math alttext="r sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> of the nozzle at the point where the water exits is <math alttext="0.002 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.002</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math>. What is the speed of the water as it exits the nozzle?

choices.label: <math alttext="0.003 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.003</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="0.3 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="3 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="30 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="30 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
